alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Pocahontas; Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 2:00PM EDT until August 07 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Randolph County in northeastern West Virginia... Northern Pocahontas County in northeastern West Virginia... Eastern Upshur County in northeastern West Virginia... Central Barbour County in northeastern West Virginia... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 200 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles east of Rock Cave, or 11 miles southeast of Buckhannon, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Philippi, Audra State Park, Belington, Mill Creek, Dailey, Beverly, Junior, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville, Montrose, Volga, Glady, Nestorville, Bowden, Kerens, Ellamore, Tallmansville, and Overhill. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 15 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern West Virginia.
